meanings.definition: Divide (a document or book) into pages.
meanings.sent1: I paginated the report for easy reading.
meanings.sent2: The novel was paginated before being printed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher paginated the homework to keep it neat.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were paginated like chapters in a book.
meanings.sent5: The librarian paginated the old manuscript carefully.

meanings.definition: Number the pages of (a document or book).
meanings.sent1: She paginated the thesis with Roman numerals.
meanings.sent2: The publisher paginated the magazine for printing.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to paginate the coloring book.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be paginated by nature.
meanings.sent5: He paginated the recipe book to keep track of his favorites.

meanings.sent1: The software automatically paginated the text.
meanings.sent2: The editor paginated the articles for the journal.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to paginate the papers by walking on them.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were paginated like a scrapbook of moments.
meanings.sent5: The designer paginated the website for better navigation.
